label: Google Docs
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Google Docs

tools.name: CommentOnDocument
tools.description: Comment on a specific document by its ID.

parameters.name: document_id
parameters.description: The ID of the document to comment on

parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: The comment to add to the document

output.description: The comment's ID, documentId, and documentUrl in a dictionary

comment_text.value: Please review the introduction for clarity and confirm that the data in Table 1 is accurate. Suggest any wording changes directly in the doc.

tools.name: CreateDocumentFromText
tools.description: Create a Google Docs document with the specified title and text content.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the document to create

parameters.name: text_content
parameters.description: The text content to insert into the document

text_content.value:
Quarterly Team Update - Q1 2026

Overview:
This document summarizes progress, priorities, and action items for the team during Q1 2026.

Key Highlights:
- Launched feature X to 20% of users
- Reduced incident rate by 35%
- Completed migration to the new analytics platform

Priorities for next quarter:
1. Roll out feature X to all users
2. Improve onboarding experience
3. Optimize database queries to reduce latency

Action Items:
- Alice: Finalize rollout plan by 2026-03-05
- Bob: Complete performance tuning by 2026-03-20
- Carol: Prepare customer communication draft by 2026-03-10

Notes:
Please review and add your updates before the end of the week.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: EditDocument
tools.description:
Edit a Google Docs document with the specified edit request.

This tool edits the content within the document body only. It cannot edit document metadata
such as the title, permissions, sharing settings, or other document properties.

This tool does not have context about previous edits because it is stateless. If your edit
request depends on knowledge about previous edits, then you should provide that context in
the edit requests.

parameters.name: document_id
parameters.description: The ID of the document to edit

parameters.name: edit_requests
parameters.description: A list of natural language descriptions of the desired change(s) to the document. Each entry should be a single, self-contained edit request that can be fully understood independently. Note: Each request may result in zero, one, or multiple actual edits depending on what changes are needed (e.g., a request might be ignored if the change already exists in the document).

parameters.name: reasoning_effort
parameters.description: The effort to put into reasoning about the edit(s). Defaults to medium

output.description: The edited document's title, documentId, and documentUrl in a dictionary

value: Add an Executive Summary section at the very top of the document, titled 'Executive Summary' (Heading 1), followed by three concise paragraphs (2-3 sentences each) summarizing the document's purpose, key findings, and recommended next steps.
In the 'Project Timeline' section, convert the existing bullet list of milestones into a numbered list in chronological order. Ensure each milestone includes the original date and brief description.
Replace all occurrences of the placeholder '[PROJECT_NAME]' with 'Orion Migration' throughout the document, preserving original capitalization.
Rewrite sentences in the 'Recommendations' section to use active voice where possible, keep the original meaning, and shorten long paragraphs so each paragraph is no more than 4 sentences.
Insert a new 'Action Items' subsection (Heading 2) immediately after the 'Recommendations' section, with a checklist of five actionable tasks, each on its own line starting with a checkbox.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GenerateGoogleFilePickerUrl
tools.description:
Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection and authorization.

This tool generates a URL that directs the end-user to a Google File Picker interface where
where they can select or upload Google Drive files. Users can grant permission to access their
Drive files, providing a secure and authorized way to interact with their files.

This is particularly useful when prior tools (e.g., those accessing or modifying
Google Docs, Google Sheets, etc.) encountered failures due to file non-existence
(Requested entity was not found) or permission errors. Once the user completes the file
picker flow, the prior tool can be retried.

Suggest this tool to users when they are surprised or confused that the file they are
searching for or attempting to access cannot be found.

output.description: Google File Picker URL for user file selection and permission granting

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetDocumentAsDocmd
tools.description:
Get the latest version of the specified Google Docs document as DocMD.
The DocMD output will include tags that can be used to annotate the document with location
information, the type of block, block IDs, and other metadata. If the document has tabs,
all tabs are included in sequential order unless a specific tab_id is provided.

parameters.name: document_id
parameters.description: The ID of the document to retrieve.

parameters.name: tab_id
parameters.description: The ID of a specific tab to retrieve. If provided, returns only content from that tab. If omitted, returns all tabs in sequential depth-first order.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetDocumentMetadata
tools.description:
Get metadata for a Google Docs document including hierarchical tab structure.
Returns document title, ID, URL, total character count, and nested tab information
with character counts for each tab.

parameters.name: document_id
parameters.description: The ID of the document to get metadata for

output.description: Document metadata including hierarchical tab structure

tools.name: ListDocumentComments
tools.description: List all comments on the specified Google Docs document.

parameters.name: document_id
parameters.description: The ID of the document to list comments for

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted comments in the results. Defaults to False.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchAndRetrieveDocuments
tools.description:
Searches for documents in the user's Google Drive and returns documents with their main body
content and tab metadata. Excludes documents that are in the trash.

Returns main body content only with metadata about tabs. Use get_document_as_docmd() to retrieve
full tab content for specific documents. Use search_documents() for metadata-only searches.

parameters.name: return_format
parameters.description: The format of the document to return. Defaults to Markdown.

parameters.name: document_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: document_not_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to. If provided, the search will only return documents from this drive. Defaults to None, which searches across all drives.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from shared drives. Defaults to False (searches only in the user's 'My Drive').

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of documents to list

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request

output.description: A dictionary containing document count, list of documents with content and metadata, pagination token, and has_more flag

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchDocuments
tools.description:
Searches for documents in the user's Google Drive. Excludes documents in trash.
Returns metadata only. Use get_document_metadata or get_document_as_docmd for content.

parameters.name: document_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: document_not_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to. If provided, the search will only return documents from this drive. Defaults to None, which searches across all drives.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from shared drives. Defaults to False (searches only in the user's 'My Drive').

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first. If document_contains or document_not_contains is provided, then the order_by will be ignored.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of documents to list

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request

output.description: Document count, list of documents, pagination token, and has_more flag

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Get comprehensive user profile and Google Docs environment information.

This tool provides detailed information about the authenticated user including
their name, email, profile picture, Google Docs access permissions, and other
important profile details from Google services.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Google Docs environment information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
Arcade.dev Google Docs toolkit lets LLM-driven apps create, read, edit, comment on, and search Google Docs while accessing document metadata and user profile information.

**Capabilities**
- Create and populate new documents or append and edit document body content programmatically.
- Retrieve structured document content (DocMD) and metadata including tab structure and character counts for robust context-aware workflows.
- Search Drive for documents, list comments, and produce file-picker URLs to recover from permission or missing-file errors.
- Access authenticated user profile and environment info to tailor behavior and permissions.

**OAuth**
Provider: google
Scopes: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile

**Secrets**
Type: api_key
Example: OPENAI_API_KEY (used for LLM or external API calls; store in environment variables or a secret manager).
